Stay_prepared_with_live_updates: Stay prepared with live updates, detailed forecasts, and alerts. Get the app today!
Low_UV_levels: No need for special protection when outdoors.
UV_rays_are_highly: You should limit going out during the middle of the day, use protective clothing, sunglasses, and sunscreen.
The_risk_from_UV_is_very_high: Increase protective measures such as wearing a wide-brimmed hat, using high SPF sunscreen, and seeking shade when outdoors.
UV_rays_are_extremely_dangerous: Avoid going outdoors during this time if possible, and if you must go out, take all possible protective measures.
outdoor_activities_safe: Everyone can engage in outdoor activities normally without worrying about air pollution.
People_with_respiratory_or_heart_disease: People with respiratory or heart disease, the elderly and children should limit prolonged exertion.
People with respiratory or heart disease, the elderly and children should avoid prolonged exertion; everyone else should limit prolonged exertion.
People with respiratory or heart disease, the elderly and children should avoid any outdoor activity; everyone else should avoid prolonged exertion.
Everyone_should_avoid_any_outdoor_exerti: Everyone should avoid any outdoor exertion; people with respiratory or heart disease, the elderly and children should remain indoors.
Unusually_sensitive_people_should_consid: Unusually sensitive people should consider reducing prolonged or heavy exertion.
Air_quality_is_satisfactory: Air quality is satisfactory and poses little or no risk
Sensitive_individuals_should_avoid: Sensitive individuals should avoid outdoor activity as they may experience respiraory symtoms.
General_public_and_sensitive: General public and sensitive individuals in particular are at risk to experience irritation and respiratory problems.
Increased_likelihood_of_adverse: Increased likelihood of adverse effects and aggravation to the heart and lungs among general public.
General_public_will: General public will be noticwably affected. Sensitive groups should restrict outdoor activities.
General_public_at_high_risk: General public at high risk of experiencing strong irritations and adverse healthy effects. Should avoid outdoor activities.

full_moon: The Moon is fully illuminated, making it the brightest phase in the lunar cycle. It creates a stunning and mystical sight in the night sky. Appears around midnight and sets at dawn.
first_quarter: Half of the Moon is illuminated (right side if viewed from the Northern Hemisphere). Occurs when the Moon has completed 1/4 of its cycle since the New Moon. Visible in the afternoon and remains until midnight.
new_moon: The Moon is completely dark and invisible from Earth as it is positioned between the Sun and Earth. Best time to observe a sky full of stars since no moonlight interferes. Often associated with new beginnings in culture and spirituality.
third_quarter: Similar to the First Quarter Moon, but the illuminated part is on the opposite side (left side if viewed from the Northern Hemisphere). Occurs when the Moon has completed 3/4 of its cycle, approaching the New Moon phase. Visible after midnight and lasts until morning.
waning_gibbous: Occurs after the Full Moon when the illuminated area starts decreasing. Still appears bright but is no longer completely full. Visible late at night and remains until early morning.
waxing_crescent: Appears after the New Moon when the illuminated part starts increasing. Only a small portion of the Moon is visible, forming a crescent shape. Seen just after sunset and disappears into the night.
waxing_gibbous: Happens before the Full Moon as the illuminated area continues to expand. The Moon looks almost full but still has a small dark portion. Appears in the evening and lasts until late at night.
moderate_or_heavy_rain_with_thunder: moderate or heavy rain with thunder
moderate_or_heavy_snow_with_thunder: moderate or heavy snow with thunder
rain_and_humid_throughout_the_day: rain and humid throughout the day

possible_light_rain_in_the_morning: possible light rain in the morning
rain_in_the_evening_and_overnight: rain in the evening and overnight
possible_light_rain_in_the_morning_and_o: possible light rain in the morning and overnight

Create_custom_code_for_your_website: Create custom code for your website and copy the embed code to where you want it to appear on your website.
Creating_and_installing: Creating and installing is extremely simple. You just need to choose the location where you want to see the weather forecast. Choose a suitable and beautiful widget template. Select the number of days of weather forecast data you want to view. Then customize the colors (Text - Background color - Border) to match the color tone of your website.
Next_is_a_custom: Next is a custom size that fits where you want to insert it on the web. And press the `Create Widget` button
Then_you_copy: Then you copy the newly created weather html code. Paste it to the location you want to display on the website. That's it. Now you just need to F5 the website again and see the results.
The_above_code: (The above code can replace the existing weather plugin on wordpress. You can customize to view Vietnam weather directly on your website)
INSTRUCTIONS_ON_WEBSITE: INSTRUCTIONS ON HOW TO INSERT WEATHER WIDGET INFORMATION INTO THE WEBSITE
